description.value: Scenario 1.3 for eOverdracht receiving systems. This test focuses on the negotiation phase ('aanmeldfase') where the receiving xis proposes an alternative transfer date, but the sending xis doesn't agree to this. The result of the negotion will be that the Patient is not transferred. Hence, there is no subsequent test for the transfer phase ('overdrachtfase').

nts:include.description: At the sending XIS, a new Task is created in status 'requested'.

nts:include.name: Notify new Task
nts:include.description: The sending XIS sends a notification to the receiving XIS because a new Task has been created with status 'requested'.

description.value: The receiving XIS should perform a read on the Task after receiving a notification that the Task has been created.
After reading the Task, the receiving XIS should perform a read operation on the advance notice Composition that is referenced on Task.input.

The receiving XIS should set the status of the Task to 'on-hold' and fill out the Task.output:alternativeDate slice to signal that it is able to transfer the patient only at some alternative date and time. This should be an update operation where the original Task is sent, with only the status and output elements changed.
Confirm that the Task resource contains 1 Composition reference for the advance notice.
Confirm that the Task.output:alternativeDate slice is populated
The sending XIS now sets the status of the Task anew to 'cancelled' to signal the receiving XIS that it doesn't agree to transfer the patient at the alternative date and time.
Set the eOverdracht Task resource to 'requested'.

nts:include.name: Notify 'cancelled' Task
nts:include.description: The sending XIS sends a notification to the receiving XIS because a new Task has been set to status 'cancelled'.

description.value: The receiving XIS should perform a read on the Task after receiving a notification that the Task has been updated.
